Start: ^Sweetie, will you sell the first drink of your opening to me?
^A sensual and unrestrained dancer sits on a walnut chair, with red velvet tassels draped over her slender belly, the white jade embellishing the tassels blends with her fair skin.

s: ^It's unexpected and an honor to have you visit my shop.
^I often heard about this town back in the capital city.

c-0: ^Rivers of fine wine, endless singing and dancing, travelers elbowing their way through, bread soaked in the scent of milk?
^You nod involuntarily, your thoughts drifting to those glorious times.
^But those days are long gone. The town used to be bigger, more prosperous, and livelier. Then, as the caravans took different routes, everything changed.
^Luxurious inns were left vacant, fine wines undrunk, and once the water source dries up, there will be nothing left here at all.
^You look at the dancer with a heavy heart, surprised.
^Just kidding, by the time the water source dries up, your grandchildren's grandchildren will have grandchildren.
^The dancer watches the young man's expression, enjoying the outcome of her jest.

s0: ^I heard the town's blacksmith secretly met with the vinegar shopkeeper's wife, and the cosmetic shop owner said the blacksmith even bought some perfume as a gift for her.
s1: ^ The town's butcher recently found a box of gold ingots, flaunting it proudly, dining lavishly in my guild hall, making quite the fool of himself.
s2: ^ The desert surrounds our town, but it's not barren. A few years ago, a drunken villager claimed to have seen a wolf haggling over a bottle of wine with a fox outside the town in an abandoned temple, though it was probably just his drunken illusion.

c-2: ^The current ruler of the town is a noblewoman. Her grandfather saved the Hami leader from wild beasts decades ago. Out of gratitude, the leader bestowed this town to him as a reward. A few years ago, the old noble passed away, and his only granddaughter inherited the title.

c-1: ^I have a friend coming over for a gathering this afternoon. Please arrange it.
^The dancer leaves the inn, walking into the desolate streets, while you clean up the cups and plates, pondering who this mysterious friend of hers could be.

Noon: ^The door is knocked loudly, and a beggar with tattered clothes stands at the entrance holding a bowl.
^Boss, may your fortune soar and luck be with you!
^The beggar says, walking into the shop on his own.
^A beggar, dressed in rags, holding a wine gourd in his hand.

s: ^Sir, may you live a long life as well.

c-0: ^Remembering some unwritten rules from the capital city, you treat the beggar with a certain level of respect and, following the etiquette of the capital city, give him a pancake and some copper coins.
^The beggar devours the pancake but doesn't even glance at the copper coins. Instead, he pulls out a shiny gold ingot from his bosom.
^Bring me a pot of your signature drink.
^Sir, what signature drink are you referring to?
^The fine wine personally brewed by the Western Regions' master, available only in your shop, don't you know?
^I too admired the master's reputation and traveled here from afar to open this inn, but by the time I arrived, it was all ruins. Could it be that the master's true legacy is still hidden here?
^What a pity! What a pity! I tasted it once when I was young
^It was the most delicious wine, truly, truly liquid gold! It seems now it exists only in my memories!
^The beggar gets up and leaves on his own after speaking.

c-1: ^Hearing you speak, the beggar seems to remember something, pulling out a small key from his dirty, torn pocket and giving it to you.
^"When I was young, I stored a lot of wine here. If you can find the cellar where the wine is stored, maybe this key can unlock it and bring the master's fine wine back to light."
^The beggar gives you a look, leaves, but when you come back to your senses, you find a lot of money missing from the counter.

Afternoon: ^In the afternoon, while preparing in the kitchen, you hear a scream, so you rush to the front hall to check.
^Just reaching the corridor, you see a huge rat scurry past you. Arriving at the front hall, you find a woman dressed as a constable trembling on top of the dancer.

s: ^Here's the spice wine you ordered (pretending nothing happened).
^To think a constable would be afraid of rats?

g-0: ^The female constable realizes someone is there and gets up from the dancer, putting on a stern face and sitting beside her.

s: ^Do you have any orders for me, ma'am?
^A little silver as a token of my respect (bribing).

g-1: ^The female constable looks at you for a long time before finally speaking.
g-2: ^The dancer glances at the female constable.
^"Forgive my sister for her abrupt words; she didn't mean that. Pour yourself a drink, and let's talk while we eat."

s: ^Why can't I run a shop here?

g-3: ^The female constable looks at you, her expression cold.
^To be exact, you can open a business anywhere in this town except for this inn."

s: ^Is there something wrong with this inn? Although there are rats, I will take care of them.

g-4: ^Hearing the word "rats," the female constable stiffens up a bit, unconsciously starts drinking to calm herself, while the dancer reluctantly takes over the conversation.
^She's trying to protect you. You're an outsider, it's understandable that you don't know, but this place, it's haunted!
g-5: ^This building has been unoccupied for a long time, but sometimes people walking at night hear footsteps inside, and sometimes even the sound of things being smashed!
g-6: ^Ah, it's a pity to say, three years ago, a female pearl merchant came here, when this place was already deserted. To save on accommodation, she stayed here, but who knew that a night watchman heard a scream at night and found her killed by a female ghost in bed!

s: ^How can you be sure it was a ghost?

g-7: ^The watchman immediately reported it to the authorities, and the constables arrived swiftly, but they found the merchant's belongings and even her
^clothes intact, yet the body mysteriously disappeared.
^To this day, it has not been found. Tell me, isn't this the work of a ghost?
^The female constable drinks another cup, then slumps over the table, overwhelmed by alcohol.
g-8: ^Ah, she mistakenly drank my strong liquor in her panic, no wonder she got drunk so quickly.
^The female constable grabs your hand as you reach out to help her up, then chuckles.
^When did such a good-looking sweetie come to town? Let your sister have a good look at you.
^The dancer pulls back the female constable, stopping her from getting too close.
^You're drunk, he's the new chef in town, planning to run the inn left by the master...
^The inn left by the master, no! Absolutely not!
g-9: ^There are no ghosts in this world! Nor fox spirits!
^It's all lies told by charlatans! What happened in this inn was a murder... case.
g-10: ^Although the merchant's valuables were untouched, all her possessions together weren't worth much.
^Most of those pearls were fake or of low quality, put them all together, and they wouldn't buy a pretty dress!
^So, the merchant was a fraudster? Could it be the killer killed her out of anger upon discovering she had no money?
^Sweetie, cooking is your forte, but catching thieves is mine.

^This person had neither a merchant guild's invitation nor any buyer's contact information, which clearly shows the 'pearl merchant' identity was just a cover! She never intended to sell those fake goods!
g-11: ^Actually, I was there when the case happened. I found a pile of ashes in the fireplace. Given the hot weather, there was no need to light a fire, so I suspected those ashes.
^In the end, my effort paid off, and I found a piece of paper in the ashes that wasn't completely burnt. It said there was gold buried in this building!
^So, I concluded it was a murder case motivated by money.
^But this happened three years ago, right?
^Yes, but in these three years, there's been no news of a large amount of old gold appearing in the area, so I believe the murderer hasn't succeeded yet, definitely lurking in some dark corner.
^I'm worried you might encounter danger running a shop here.
^Also, I've identified a suspect, who is right here in our town, it's... it's... zzz...
^The dancer pushes the constable, shakes her head, indicating she's completely passed out.
^You watch the dancer carry away the drunk constable, pondering over the murder case mentioned by the constable.
